citation.article-title: Transfer of Haemophilus vaginalis Gardner and Dukes to a new genus, Gardnerella: G. vaginalis (Gardner and Dukes) comb. nov.

p.s: Gardnerella (Gard.ner.el'la. M.L. dim. ending -ella; M. L. fem. n. Gardnerella;
Gram-negative to gram-variable, rod-shaped bacteria with laminated cell walls.
Catalase and oxidase are not produced.
Acetic acid is produced as the major end product of fermentation (24).
Found in the human genital/urinary tract, where it causes vaginitis.
The type species is G. vaginalis (Gardner and Dukes) comb. nov.
